cyclone.name: CLAUDETTE
cyclone.category: Tropical Storm (potential/unnamed at time of advisory)
cyclone.current_location: about 125 miles south of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving north toward the north-central Gulf Coast, then forecast to arc northeastward across the southeastern United States through the weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-central Gulf Coast near the Louisiana/Mississippi coastline

weather_observation.watch_coast: None – watches confined to the north-central Gulf Coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warning from east of Morgan City, LA to the Okaloosa/Walton County line, FL (incl. New Orleans, Lake Pontchartrain/Maurepas)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central Gulf Coast (LA–MS–AL–western FL Panhandle) spreading inland across the Deep South
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None listed for Boston, MA in wind-probability table
weather_observation.wind: No tropical-storm-force winds expected at Boston; only light fringe breezes possible once remnants pass offshore mid-week.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for Boston – surge confined to Gulf Coast and adjacent bays.
weather_observation.rainfall: Remnant moisture could produce scattered showers mid-week but heavy totals (>4”) are not anticipated.
weather_observation.other_hazards: None anticipated that would disrupt port operations.
